parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0
Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CE.STUDYID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: STUDYID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CE.SITEID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted for the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: SITEID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CE.SUBJID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be provided to the site using a pre-populated list in the system. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to Study Data Tabulation Model.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: SUBJID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CE.CECAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the clinical event category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a pre-printed category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Category for Clinical Events
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: CECAT
fields.questionText: What is the category of the clinical event?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CE.CESCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the clinical event subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the CECAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer.. CESCAT can only be used if there is an CECAT and it must be a subcategorization of CECAT.
fields.label: Subcategory for Clinical Event
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: CESCAT
fields.questionText: What is the subcategory of the clinical event?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CE.CEYN

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if the subject experienced any clinical events. If yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.
fields.definition: An indication whether or not any clinical events were experienced during the study.
fields.implementationNotes: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.
fields.label: Any Clinical Event
fields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM Annotated CRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
fields.name: CEYN

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CE.CESPID

fields.completionInstructions: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.
fields.definition: A sponsor-defined identifier which can be used for pre-printed or auto-generated numbers on the CRF.
fields.implementationNotes: Since SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile concomitant medications, procedures and/or medical history records with CEs. If CMCENO or PRCENO is used, this is the identifier to which CMCENO or PRCENO refers. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.
fields.label: Clinical Event Sponsor-Defined Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
fields.name: CESPID
fields.questionText: What is the clinical event identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CE.CETERM

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Reported Term for the Clinical Event

fields.completionInstructions: Record the clinical event or [insert text corresponding to the specific clinical event].
fields.definition: The reported or pre-specified name of the for the clinical event.
fields.implementationNotes: Can be represented either as an open entry field to capture verbatim terms reported by subjects or could be pre-printed in the situation where solicited CEs of interest are captured. In most cases, the verbatim term (i.e., investigator-reported term) will be coded to a standard medical dictionary such as MedDRA or WHO ART, after the data have been collected on the CRF
fields.label: Clinical Event Reported Term
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: CETERM
fields.questionText: What is the clinical event term?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CE.CEOCCUR

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if [specific clinical event] has occurred/is occurring by checking Yes or No.
fields.definition: An indication whether a pre-specified clinical event or a group of clinical events occurred when information about the occurrence of a specific event is solicited.
fields.implementationNotes: The CDASH variable CEOCCUR is used to report the occurrence of a pre-specified clinical event not considered to be an adverse event by the sponsor. CEOCCUR should not be used for spontaneously reported events. The site should be able to indicate that the response was not asked or answered.
fields.label: Clinical Event Occurrence
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: CEOCCUR
fields.questionText: Did the subject have [pre-specified clinical event/group of clinical events ]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CE.CEPRESP

fields.definition: An indication that a specific event, or group of events, are pre-specified on a CRF.
fields.implementationNotes: A hidden field on a CRF defaulted to Y, or added during the SDTM-based dataset creation when the clinical event is pre-specified. Null for spontaneously reported events. If a study collects both pre-specified clinical events as well as free-text events, the value of CEPRESP should be Y for all pre-specified events and null for events reported as free-text. CEPRESP is a permissible field in SDTM and may be omitted from the SDTM-based dataset if all events were collected as free text.
fields.label: Clinical Event Pre-Specified
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: CEPRESP

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CE.CESTDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the start date of the [clinical event ] using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The start date of the clinical event represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: N/A
fields.label: Clinical Event Start Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CESTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: CESTDAT
fields.questionText: What was the [clinical event] start date?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CE.CESTTIM

fields.completionInstructions: If appropriate, record the start time (as complete as possible) of the [clinical event].
fields.definition: The start time of the clinical event represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: Collecting the time an CE started is only appropriate if it can be realistically determined and if there is a scientific reason for needing to know this level of detail. An example is where the subject is under the direct care of the site at the time the event started and the study design is such that it is important to know the CE start time with respect to dosing.
fields.label: Start Time of Clinical Event
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CESTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: CESTTIM
fields.questionText: What was the [clinical event] start time?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C74456

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CE.CELOC

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate the anatomical location of the clinical event.
fields.definition: A description of the anatomical location relevant for the clinical event.
fields.implementationNotes: Collected or pre-printed when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of Controlled Terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.
fields.label: Clinical Event Location
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: CELOC
fields.questionText: What was the anatomical location of the [clinical event]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99073

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CE.CELAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the side of the anatomical location of the clinical event.
fields.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the side of the body relevant for the event.
fields.implementationNotes: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of Controlled Terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Clinical Event Laterality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: CELAT
fields.questionText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the [clinical event]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99074

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CE.CEDIR

fields.completionInstructions: Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the clinical event.
fields.definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
fields.implementationNotes: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of Controlled Terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Clinical Event Directionality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: CEDIR
fields.questionText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the [clinical event]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99075

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CE.CEPORTOT

self.title: Clinical Event Location Portion or Totality

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate the portion or totality anatomical location of the clinical event.
fields.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the distribution, which means arrangement of, apportioning of.
fields.implementationNotes: Collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific portionality for the anatomical locations. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of Controlled Terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Clinical Event Location Portion or Totality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: CEPORTOT
fields.questionText: What was the portion or totality of the anatomical location of the clinical event?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CE.CEONGO

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point

fields.completionInstructions: Check the box if the clinical event has not resolved at the time of data collection; leave the End Date blank.
fields.definition: Indication the clinical event is ongoing when no end date is provided.
fields.implementationNotes: Completed to indicate that the CE has not resolved at the time of data collection, when no End Date is collected. In some cases the ongoing status may be determined from CE Outcome. The purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring, since this field provides further confirmation that the End Date was deliberately left blank. Often used as a tick/checkbox.
fields.label: Ongoing Clinical Event
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTMIG relative timing variable such as CEENRF or CEENRTPT. When populating CEENRF, if the value of CEONGO is "Y", the value of "DURING", "AFTER" or "DURING/AFTER" may be used. When populating CEENRTPT, if the value of CEONGO is "Y", the value of "ONGOING" may be used. When CEONGO refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC) the SDTMIG variable CEENRF should be populated. When CEONGO is compared to any other time point, the SDTMIG variables CEENRTPT and CEENTPT should be used. Note: CEENRTPT must refer to a time point anchor described in CEENTPT.
fields.name: CEONGO

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CE.CEENDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the date that the [clinical event] resolved using this format (DD-MON-YYYY). If the [clinical event] is ongoing, leave the field blank.
fields.definition: The date when the clinical event resolved/ended represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: The definition of resolved is sponsor specific. The preferred method is to collect a complete end date. Partial dates (e.g., providing year only or month and year only) may be acceptable.
fields.label: Clinical Event End Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CEENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: CEENDAT
fields.questionText: What was the [clinical event] end date?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CE.CEENTIM

fields.completionInstructions: Record the time (as complete as possible) that the [clinical event] resolved.
fields.definition: The time when the clinical event ended/resolved represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: Collecting the time an CE resolved is only appropriate if it can be realistically determined and if there is a scientific reason for needing to know this level of detail. An example is where the subject is under the direct care of the site at the time the event resolved and the study design is such that it is important to know the CE end time with respect to dosing.
fields.label: End Time of Clinical Event
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CEENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: CEENTIM
fields.questionText: What was the [clinical event] end time?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CE.CESEV

fields.completionInstructions: The reporting physician/healthcare professional will assess the severity of the event using the sponsor-defined categories. This assessment is subjective and the reporting physician/ healthcare professional should use medical judgment to compare the reported clinical event to similar type events observed in clinical practice.
fields.definition: The severity or intensity of the event.
fields.implementationNotes: Some studies may collect Severity and/or Toxicity Grade.
fields.label: Clinical Event Severity/Intensity
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". The sponsor is expected to provide the toxicity scale name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external code list attributes.
fields.name: CESEV
fields.questionText: What was the severity of the [clinical event]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CE.CETOX

fields.completionInstructions: Record the description of the toxicity.
fields.definition: A description of toxicity quantified by CETOXGR such as NCI CTCAE Short Name.
fields.implementationNotes: This would typically be the text description quantified by CETOXGR (e.g., HYPERCALCEMIA, HYPOCALCEMIA)
fields.label: Clinical Event Toxicity Description
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". The sponsor is expected to provide the toxicity scale name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external code list attributes.
fields.name: CETOX
fields.questionText: What was the description of the toxicity?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CE.CETOXGR

fields.completionInstructions: Severity CTCAE Grade The reporting physician/healthcare professional will assess the severity of the Clinical event using the toxicity grades.
fields.definition: The toxicity grade using a standard toxicity scale (such as the NCI CTCAE).
fields.implementationNotes: Some studies may collect Severity and/or Toxicity Grade. The CDISC Controlled Terminology (TOXGRV3); (TOXGRV4) may be used.
fields.label: Clinical Event Toxicity Grade
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". The sponsor is expected to provide the toxicity scale name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external code list attributes.
fields.name: CETOXGR

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CE.CEMODIFY

fields.definition: If the value for CETERM is modified to facilitate coding, then CEMODIFY will contain the modified text.
fields.implementationNotes: This is not a data collection field that will appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process.
fields.label: Clinical Event Modified Term
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: CEMODIFY

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CE.CEDECOD

fields.definition: The dictionary or sponsor defined standardized text description of CETERM or the modified topic variable (CEMODIFY), if applicable.
fields.implementationNotes: This is typically not a data collection field that will appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. Equivalent to the Preferred Term (PT in MedDRA).
fields.label: Clinical Event Dictionary-Derived/Standardized Term
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".
fields.name: CEDECOD

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0
